website_summaries.verdict: Inov-8 expands the range of choices for runners in the X-Talon series by introducing the 225. It is built for the fast runner for fell or mountain running. The shoe stands out in the mud, grass, and rock. Obstacle course racers also get another very solid option in this shoe. At a very reasonable price, runners can get unbelievable traction, excellent responsiveness, water-repellent coverage, and decent arch support. Running on rugged and extremely challenging terrain should be quite fun in this shoe.
pros: Many off-road and obstacle course enthusiasts consider the X-Talon 225 as very comfortable
Several consumers applauded the lightweight nature of this shoe
According to some reviewers, they’d received great quality for the price of this product
they wrote that it was a good investment
It is really responsive, based on the comments of several runners
The 8 mm gripping lugs and the new sticky rubber provided excellent traction and grip, noted those who have tested it
A number of runners have noted that the materials used here were able to dry quickly after being exposed to water
The breathability is superb, as remarked by some
Some runners stated that the X-Talon 225 was exceptionally durable despite being very lightweight
The upper cover system and underfoot platform received positive recognition for being flexible
Ground feedback is excellent in this shoe, reported several reviewers
cons: The fit of the 225 X-Talon is quite narrow for some
The sole unit felt a bit stiff, according to a handful of testers
The aggressive gripping lugs didn’t make the shoe comfortable or stable on flat and hard surfaces, a few runners commented
Some runners reported that that small rocks got into the foot-chamber via the low-cut collar
A small number of OCR lovers remarked that the drainage system wasn’t very efficient when it came to sluicing out water
Several Inov-8 diehards wished for a Standard Fit for the X-Talon 225
the Precision Fit felt too tight for them

customer_reviews.title: Great grippy trail shoe - buy your actual size.
customer_reviews.text: Ran my first cross country in them this morning and they were great. Really grippy on the slippy mud, secure on compacted gravel and comfortable on the tarmac. Some reviewers advised getting half a size larger due to the toe area being fairly small - I did not find this to be the case after I followed this advice and wish I hadn't - I got a 9.5 but a 9 would have fitted much better. My feet are definitely not narrow so you might want to order your actual size and see if they are too tight for you and exchange for a bigger size if required.
customer_reviews.author: Neil M

customer_reviews.title: they're light and sturdy and definitely worth the money you spend on them
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a charity run in the lake district, they're light and sturdy and definitely worth the money you spend on them. Can't fault these shoes and would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: zoe h

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I would recommend buying your usual size
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I would recommend buying your usual size. I went half a size bigger based on another review which indicated that they come a bit on the smaller size but was unnecessary and they are slightly big.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Long

customer_reviews.title: Short and skinny (shoes not me)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size bigger but they are still small - short and narrow. Look pretty and nice soles though
customer_reviews.author: gnasher

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Excellent traction on rocks and mud and loose chippings lightweight and flexible just the job
customer_reviews.author: charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Slim fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy one size larger because the fit is verry narrow. It works fine, but toes tend to be squised from the top fabric when shoe bends in forward motion IF shoe is not tightened verry correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kim LL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good grip on all surfaces are narrow fitting might not suit everyone had the predecessor before
customer_reviews.author: poss

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very sad the nose of the shoe is so tight. Beautiful shoe, but had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Claykens

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, absolutely love them
customer_reviews.text: Excellent , absolutely love them. I read previous reviews and I brought the size I usually wear didn't buy bigger and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: San

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for wild running
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable ideal for a slim foot good traction apart from wet drain covers! Great value
customer_reviews.author: Tony Minton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Huge lugs felt weird but enjoying running in them now.
customer_reviews.author: Clare G

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used the trainers yet and won't until the ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the trainers yet and won't until the weather changes. However, having read other reviews about size and fit, I decided to order a half size up from my usual fit. It was the right choice, the trainers are a small fit and you will need the next half size up
customer_reviews.author: David Clarke

product_meta.title: inov-8 Inov8 X-Talon 225 Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Inov8 X-Talon 225 Unisex Trail Running Shoes For all extreme terrain running, including off-trail conditions encountered on mountains and fells. Surge through the trails with unrelenting traction in the Inov-8 X-Talon 225. Featuring a Dual-C rubber outsole with an aggressive lug configuration, this performance trail shoe offers sticky grip to take on the toughest of terrain. Upper - Met-Cradle/Synthetic Mesh The Inov8 X-Talon 225 Trail Unisex Running Shoes is composed of a synthetic Mesh which covers the upper for lightweight, breathable coverage. The ventilated construction actively allows air to permeate the interior footbed for reliable freshness to the feet. Get more miles out of your shoes: Industry-leading lightweight upper material increases durability. The material, combined with the new mesh tongue, further aids shoe breathability and comfort. The upper construction is covered with a DWR (durable water repellent) treatment, this is water resistant and breathable layer that provides partial weather protection from rainy days but does not fully diminish the effect if the weather gets more intense. Cradling the upper structure, Inov8's Met-Cradle is a synthetic webbing upper that links the eyelets and supports the forefoot, providing a secure fit and feel. It locks the foot in place for a superior hold, bringing the material closer to the foot for better flexibility and responsiveness. Finally, a TPU Lacing System uses TPU lacing supports for a strong, lightweight and secure fit. Working in unison with the eyelets, securing and supporting the foot through transition and enjoy more protection: Reinforced toe box delivers outstanding protection on descents, and against stones and other debris. Midsole - Injected EVA/1 Arrow Shoc-Zone The midsole for the Inov8 X-Talon 225 is set with an Injected EVA Foam for resilient cushioning with maximum memory retention. The active compound reduces resistance and forces pressed upon the underfoot, engaging a smo
feature_bullets: Synthetic Mesh - Covers the upper for lightweight, breathable coverage.
DWR (durable water repellent) treated upper - Is water resistant and breathable.
Met-Cradle - Is a synthetic webbing upper that supports the forefoot and provide a secure fit.
TPU Lacing System - Uses TPU lacing supports for a strong, lightweight and secure fit.
Performance Last - Is a close fitting design for a snug fit and optimal performance.
